W
CFG_WRITE_HEADER
When defined, if the pointer to currently selected file equals 0 at any point where it would cause mysterious SEGFAULTS etc.
Outputs summary, number of tests passed and total tests.
Tests two booleans, if they are different, outputs what error occured.
Tests two floats, if they are different, outputs what error occured.
Tests two integers, if they are different, outputs what error occured.
Tests two strings, if they are different, outputs what error occured.
Marks the start of automated test procedure.
Defines that library will be build as dynamically linked library.
Defines that library will be build as static lib.
Check if entry exists in currently selected group.
Read the value of entry with key name.
Remove specified entry from currently selected group.
Change the value of entry with key name.
int CFG_ClearFile(CFG_File *file =  CFG_SELECTED)
Removes all groups and entries from file.
int CFG_CloseFile(CFG_File *file =  CFG_SELECTED)
If file is not null (!0), function closes file that was passed in.
If defined, library will be sending debugging output to stderr.
First, you should know, that in order to change behaviour of SDL_Config, you must make changes directly in SDL config cfg.h file, then recompile SDL_Config, and finally recompile your application.
If you don’t have the time or the will to read everything at this page, I recommend you to look at least at the following example, so you will get the feel of what is and isn’t legal to do in the current version of SDL_Config.
This little structure is used to determine on what file we are working currently.
CFG_String filename
Name of hard-drive file, which was used to create this CFG_Internal_File.
Uint32 CFG_GetGroupCount(void)
Returns the number of groups in currently selected file ( not counting global group ).
CFG_File * CFG_GetSelectedFile(void)
Returns pointer to selected file.
CFG_String_Arg CFG_GetSelectedFileName(void)
Returns the name of file, from which the currently selected config file has been initially loaded.
CFG_String_Arg CFG_GetSelectedGroupName(void)
Returns the name of currently selected group in currently selected file.
CFG_Internal_Group global_group
Global group is not stored directly in map, because we would have to reserve some kind of ID for global group name.
After every change in functions that iterate, it’s dereferenced and its value is assigned to selected_group.
CFG_Bool CFG_GroupExists(CFG_String_Arg group)
Check if group exists in currently selected file.
CFG_Internal_GroupMap groups
Map which contains all groups.
Encapsulates single entry with its value.
Keeps entries of all types in single text-based map.
CFG_Bool CFG_IsLastGroup(void)
Returns CFG_True if you have reached past the end of all groups (just like STL containers member function end() ).
int iteration_direction
1 means we’re iterating to front group_iterator) -1 means we’re reverse iterating (reverse_group_iterator)
float CFG_LinkedVersion(void)
Version of the dynamically linked SDL_Config library.
No testing, just outputs what was passed in.
Uint32 next_entry_order
Next created entry will have such order.
Uint32 next_group_order
Next created group will have such order.
int CFG_OpenFile(CFG_String_Arg filename,
CFG_File *file)
Opens and parses file.
int CFG_OpenFile_RW(SDL_RWops *source,
CFG_File *file)
The same as CFG_OpenFile, the only difference is that it loads file directly from SDL_RWops stream.
Uint32 order
Used to sort entries during save operation in order as in file they were originally read from.
Uint32 order
Used to sort groups during save operation in order as in file they were originally read from.
CFG_String post_comment
String which is holding comment that was found after entry definition, ie.
CFG_String post_comment
String which is holding comment that was found after group definition, ie.
Uint8 post_comment_type
Currently for padding, maybe in later versions it will contain type of post comment (now it’s not needed).
CFG_String pre_comment
String which is holding comment that was found before entry definition, ie.
CFG_String pre_comment
String which is holding comment that was found before group definition, ie.
Uint8 pre_comment_type
Uint8 pre_comment_type
If enabled, then library will generate to stdout how much miliseconds it took to Open/Save files.
If enabled, spaces from within group declarations will be removed, otherwise they will stay untouched, ie.
int CFG_RemoveGroup(CFG_String_Arg group =  CFG_GLOBAL)
Removes group with appropriate name.
void CFG_RemoveSelectedGroup(void)
Removes currently selected group.
int CFG_SaveFile(CFG_String_Arg filename =  0,
int mode =  CFG_SORT_ORIGINAL,
int flags =  CFG_SPACE_ENTRIES)
Saves currently selected file to filename.
int CFG_SaveFile_RW(SDL_RWops *destination,  
int mode =  CFG_SORT_ORIGINAL,
int flags =  CFG_SPACE_ENTRIES)
The same as CFG_SaveFile, the only difference is that it saves file directly to SDL_RWops stream.
They don’t form part of SDL_Config API, rather than are used by test programs, to automatically determine whether SDL_Config contains bugs in tested functions.
CFG_Internal_Group * selected_group
Selected group.
void CFG_SelectFile(CFG_File *file)
Selects this file for all further operations.
int CFG_SelectGroup(CFG_String_Arg group =  CFG_GLOBAL,
CFG_Bool create =  CFG_True)
Selects group with appropriate name in the currently selected file.
void CFG_SelectNextGroup(void)
Selects next group, in alphabethical order.
We are using SDL’s error handling system.
Sets the direction of iteration for the currently selected file.
void CFG_StartGroupIteration(void)
Selects first group.
This documentation shouldn’t be mixed with normal library API, it is documentation of internal SDL_Config structures, and as such, it’s not for normal library user.
Uint8 type
Depending on “type”’s value, “value” is treated and converted differently.
If not defined, functions that operate on bools will be changed to int.
It controls what version of function definitions will be compiled: those with or without default values.
CFG_String value
String which is holding unconverted value.
Outputs initial “greetings text”.
